Comment: This was a blitz game that I played on Gameknot. It's short, but it has a good lesson inside it.
Trying the Scholar's mate (4 move checkmate)
Trying the Scholar's mate (4 move checkmate)
I thought of this little defense 3 years ago (2010). Prevents the Queen from going to h5, and if the Queen goes to f3, she isn't threatening anything.
??? Maybe he missed the significance of my last move?
Preparing to develop his bishop, protects the pawn and bishop. Pretty good move.
Preparing to develop his bishop, protects the pawn and bishop. Pretty good move.
The reason I lose a lot of my games is because I don't castle. Always castle early in the game.
2 attackers, 2 defenders. I'm OK on f6.
I am thinking about Bg4. Would that have been good?
Here I begin to worry. Qg3+, and my king is not very safe.
Here I begin to worry. Qg3+, and my king is not very safe.
Lucky me, I guess. He resigned at this point. Here's my big message, THINK BEFORE DOING! Don't just blindly make a move based on 2 seconds of thinking. Sianarah, everyone.
